name: AlUla
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, AlUla is known for its stunning rock formations and ancient tombs. It offers a glimpse into the rich history of the Nabateans.

name: Madain Saleh
description: Another UNESCO site, Madain Saleh features well-preserved Nabatean tombs carved into sandstone mountains, showcasing incredible archaeological significance.

name: Riyadh's National Museum
description: This museum offers an extensive overview of Arabian history and culture, with interactive exhibits and artifacts dating back to prehistoric times.

name: Diriyah
description: A historic town that served as the original home of the Saudi royal family, Diriyah features beautiful mud-brick architecture and is a symbol of Saudi heritage.

name: Al Khobar Corniche
description: This picturesque waterfront promenade offers stunning views of the Arabian Gulf, with parks, walking paths, and recreational activities for families.

name: Abha
description: Known for its cool climate and lush landscapes, Abha is a perfect getaway featuring the Asir National Park and stunning views of the surrounding mountains.

name: Jeddah Corniche
description: A scenic waterfront area featuring parks, sculptures, and the iconic King Fahd Fountain, the Jeddah Corniche is perfect for leisurely strolls and picnics.

name: Taif
description: Famous for its rose gardens and cool climate, Taif is a charming mountain town that offers beautiful landscapes and a vibrant local culture.

name: King Fahd's Fountain
description: The tallest water fountain in the world, King Fahd's Fountain is a stunning sight, especially when illuminated at night, and a symbol of Jeddah.

name: Qasr Marid
description: An ancient fort in Najran, Qasr Marid showcases the region's history and architecture, standing testament to the area's rich past.

name: The Edge of the World
description: A breathtaking geological wonder featuring dramatic cliffs that overlook the surrounding plains, offering stunning views and a serene atmosphere.

name: Al-Ahsa Oasis
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Al-Ahsa is a lush oasis known for its date palms, historical sites, and traditional mud-brick architecture.

name: King Abdulaziz Historical Center
description: A cultural complex that includes museums and gardens, this center offers insights into the history and development of Saudi Arabia.

name: Al-Balad
description: The old town of Jeddah, Al-Balad is characterized by its traditional coral houses and historical sites, reflecting the city's rich trading history.

name: Wadi Rum
description: Known for its stunning desert landscapes, Wadi Rum offers adventure seekers options for rock climbing, hiking, and exploring ancient petroglyphs.

name: Jebel al-Lawz
description: A mountain that is said to be the biblical Mount Sinai, Jebel al-Lawz is surrounded by beautiful landscapes and is perfect for hiking enthusiasts.

name: Al-Soudah Park
description: A picturesque park located in the Asir region, Al-Soudah offers cool weather, stunning views, and opportunities for hiking and picnicking.

name: Al-Namas
description: Known for its beautiful nature and scenic views, Al-Namas is a charming destination with lush green valleys and traditional villages.

name: Heritage Village
description: A cultural attraction showcasing traditional Saudi architecture and crafts, the Heritage Village provides insight into the customs and history of the region.

name: Buraidah's Date Market
description: One of the largest date markets in the world, Buraidah's market offers a wide variety of dates and a glimpse into the local agricultural culture.

name: Al-Diriyah Gate
description: A historic district in Riyadh that preserves the traditional architecture and rich history of the Saudi dynasty, offering a cultural experience.

name: Jeddah Sculpture Museum
description: An open-air museum featuring contemporary sculptures from local and international artists, located along the Jeddah Corniche.

name: Khobar's Half Moon Bay
description: A beautiful beach area perfect for water sports, picnics, and family outings, known for its crescent-shaped coastline.

name: The Red Sea Project
description: An ambitious tourism development project that aims to create a luxury resort destination along the stunning Red Sea coast.

name: Al-Faisaliah Tower
description: One of Riyadh's most iconic skyscrapers, featuring a unique globe-shaped top and offering panoramic views of the city from its observation deck.

name: Al-Masmak Fortress
description: A historic mud-brick fort that played a key role in the unification of Saudi Arabia, now serving as a museum showcasing the country's history.

name: Kingdom Centre
description: A prominent skyscraper with a distinctive design, featuring a sky bridge and a shopping mall, offering spectacular views of Riyadh.

name: Al-Jawf
description: Known for its ancient ruins and archaeological sites, Al-Jawf offers a glimpse into pre-Islamic history with its rock carvings and forts.

name: Al-Hasa Heritage Village
description: A traditional village showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the Al Ahsa region, with museums, crafts, and historical architecture.

name: Ushaiger Heritage Village
description: A preserved traditional village that reflects the architectural style and lifestyle of Saudi Arabia's past, complete with museums and handicrafts.

name: Al-Salam Palace
description: A royal palace known for its impressive architecture and gardens, showcasing the beauty of traditional Saudi design.

name: Al-Masjid an-Nabawi
description: The second holiest mosque in Islam, it is a site of pilgrimage for millions, featuring stunning architecture and a peaceful atmosphere.

name: Mount Uhud
description: A historic site of a famous battle in Islamic history, Mount Uhud offers hiking opportunities and panoramic views of the surrounding area.

name: Al-Baha
description: A stunning mountainous region known for its natural beauty, cool climate, and vibrant local culture, perfect for outdoor activities.

name: Farasan Islands
description: A beautiful archipelago in the Red Sea, known for its pristine beaches, coral reefs, and rich marine life, ideal for diving and snorkeling.

name: The Empty Quarter (Rub' al Khali)
description: The largest continuous sand desert in the world, offering stunning dunes and a sense of adventure for those willing to explore its remote beauty.

name: Quba Mosque
description: The first mosque built in Islam, Quba Mosque is a significant religious site with beautiful architecture and a serene atmosphere.

name: Al-Fahad Park
description: A large urban park offering green spaces, walking paths, and recreational facilities, perfect for families and outdoor enthusiasts.

name: Qasr Al-Masmak
description: A historic fort that played a significant role in the kingdom's history, now serving as a museum showcasing artifacts from the unification of Saudi Arabia.

name: Nassif House Museum
description: A beautifully restored historic home that provides insight into the lifestyle of Jeddah's elite in the 19th century, featuring traditional architecture and artifacts.

name: Al-Jouf Olive Oil Factory
description: One of the largest olive oil producers in the region, this factory offers tours and tastings, showcasing the importance of olive farming in Saudi culture.

name: King Abdullah Park
description: A large urban park featuring beautiful landscapes, walking paths, and recreational areas, perfect for relaxation and family outings.

name: Al-Majma'ah
description: A lesser-known city with a rich history, featuring traditional architecture and local markets that reflect the cultural heritage of the region.

name: Al-Qarah Mountain
description: A unique geological formation with stunning caves and rock formations, offering hiking opportunities and beautiful views of the surrounding landscape.

name: Jeddah's Floating Mosque
description: A stunning mosque built on stilts over the sea, offering breathtaking views and a peaceful atmosphere for worshippers and visitors alike.

name: Abha's Cable Car
description: Offering panoramic views of the Asir mountains, the cable car ride is a thrilling experience that showcases the stunning landscapes of Abha.

name: Al-Ula's Elephant Rock
description: A natural rock formation resembling an elephant, this stunning geological feature is a popular spot for photography and exploration.

name: Wadi Hanifah
description: A beautiful valley that offers a refreshing escape from the city, featuring walking paths, parks, and natural landscapes.

name: Al-Madhbah
description: A significant historical site near Makkah, known for its association with the rituals of Hajj and its proximity to the sacred city.

name: King Khalid Grand Mosque
description: One of the largest mosques in Saudi Arabia, known for its impressive architecture and serene atmosphere, welcoming visitors for prayer and reflection.

name: Khamis Mushait
description: A city rich in cultural heritage, known for its traditional crafts, vibrant markets, and proximity to the stunning Asir mountains.
